p: Thymus vulgaris has demonstrated antiviral activity against herpes simplex virus (HSV) ( Nolkemper et al., 2006), influenzavirus ( Vimalanathan and Hudson, 2014), Newcastle Disease virus ( Rezatofighi et al., 2014), PRRSV ( Kaewprom et al., 2017) and IBV ( Lele≈°ius et al., 2019), even if the antiviral mechanism has yet to be clarified. Conversely, the inhibition of replication of Human Immunodeficiency Virus in vitro by TEO was elucidated ( Feriotto et al., 2018).
